description.S1: Silas, the local gravedigger, asked you to collect money from a few workers late on their payments.

blurb.B1: Quest obtained by talking to Silas at the entrance of Edgewater, in the Emerald Vale.
blurb.B2: Silas wants you to collect overdue grave fees from several other workers.

description.S1: Ludwig is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: He's stationed as a guard at the Landing Pad southeast of Edgewater.

blurb.B1: Ludwig Miller can be found at Edgewater Landing Pad,
blurb.B2: just outside Edgewater to the southeast.
blurb.B3: When you talk to him, you'll learn he fears an impending war against machines.
blurb.B4: Go along with it and offer to help.
blurb.B5: When you deal with the robot he will tell you there's a weapon in the Cantina's lavatory.
blurb.B6: After, mention Silas and he will pay up assuming Silas has heard the calling.
blurb.B7: You can lie (5) to get some extra loot out of him.
blurb.B8: Alternatively: You can kill him and collect his fees.

description.S1: Conrad is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: He runs a barber shop in Edgewater.

blurb.B1: Conrad Sadik is located in the Barber Shop inside Edgewater.
blurb.B2: You can talk to him and find out he is quite happy with his position at Edgewater,
blurb.B3: but he is broke and cannot afford the gravesite fee.
blurb.B4: He will offer his apologies and acceptance to have his Medical Rights revoked as he will have to default on this payment.
blurb.B5: He reveals he had the plague and was deemed worthy of treatment,
blurb.B6: but since the barber shop is not profitable he has spent his savings to keep it afloat.
blurb.B7: Tell him to give Silas an "I owe you".
blurb.B8: He will need something to give as collateral.
blurb.B9: Go to the back room and inspect a ledger and you'll find a note from Phyllis mentioning a receptionist's suicide and asking Conrad to pull the teeth.
blurb.B10: You can find the Golden Teeth items at the Botanical Labs greenhouse and bring them back,
blurb.B11: then use Persuade (1) and tell him that you have them.
blurb.B12: You will then receive 360xp and complete this portion of the quest.
blurb.B13: Alternatively: You can kill him for his Gravesite Fee

description.S1: Abernathy is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: He's been feeling under the weather and is probably at his residence.

blurb.B1: Martin Abernathy can be found in his home inside Edgewater.
blurb.B2: You can easily talk him into paying you his Gravesite Fee (360xp),
blurb.B3: and he'll give you the Quest: The Long Tomorrow if you agree to help him retrieve the medicine cache from the Community Center,
blurb.B4: as the company policy excludes him from treatment.

description.S1: Phyllis is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: She works as a supervisor in the Edgewater cannery.

blurb.B1: Phyllis Granger can be found at the Saltuna Cannery, on the upper ramparts.
blurb.B2: She is the foreman and not a pleasant conversationalist,
blurb.B3: so get to the point and ask her about the gravesite fees.
blurb.B5: You will notice that the papers are not signed in her name.
blurb.B6: She will reveal she's paying for one of her worker's grave.
blurb.B7: Since Eugene "vandalized company property" by killing himself,
blurb.B8: Phyllis has to pay for discovering it.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Don't go ambling out in those hills. That's marauder territory, friend.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm just passing through.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How do you know I'm not a marauder?

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ain't safe out here. You'd best head into town, avail yourself of Edgewater's high walls and low, low prices.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I never got your name. I'm <oeitoken>PlayerName</oeitoken>.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Do they pay you to chat with strangers?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is that why you've got a pair of armed guards?

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Pleased to make your acquaintanceship. I'd shake your hand, but I been hauling corpses. You don't want none of that on you.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Name's Silas. Junior Inhumer for the town of Edgewater. We're all part of the Spacer's Choice family.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm looking to make a little money while I'm here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This place looks like it's falling to pieces.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be on my way.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Got a knack for being discreet-like? There's money to be made, long as you keep your nose clean.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Edgewater is a company town. Board owned and operated. That includes the cemetery. None of us own our gravesites - we rent 'em from the company.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Renting means money. Money means paperwork. Paperwork means signatures. Some of our family's become a mite delinquent in paying their dues, you see.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You want me to collect what's owed to you. I can do that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're making people pay for their own graves?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why can't you collect these fees yourself?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let me ask you about something else.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sure you'll figure something out. Excuse me.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Four workers still haven't paid up. Phyllis, Conrad, Ludwig, and Martin Abernathy. He's a special case. You may wanna twist his arm a little.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why is Abernathy a special case?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Where can I find these people?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be back.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: He just is. Look, I don't want to get into it. Just make sure he pays up.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: There was something else I wanted to ask you.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yeah?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This town must be in pretty bad shape, if it's keeping you employed.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You lose a lot of people to marauders?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How long have you been a Junior Inhumer? Gravedigger. Whatever.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I should go.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: You could look at it that way, I suppose. You could look at us and say, "Those Edgewater saps lost near every soul to plague."

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: But you'd be wrong. We're survivors. Loyal company folk braving the wilds.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I should go.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Former people, yeah. Marauders been raiding my graves, you see. Hence the armed guards.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Any idea where they're coming from?

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Couldn't tell you. No, I mean, I'm contractually prohibited from saying anything that might reflect poorly on Spacer's Choice.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ah, void it. Shouldn't have said that either. Look, forget I said anything.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Thanks for your time.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hang on. I'm doing some math in my head. Twenty, thirty, carry the one - uh, all my life.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Work's been real good to me. Fresh air. Exercise. Only problem's the paperwork. Can't get anybody to pay their gravesite fees.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's all for now.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Conrad's got a barber shop in town. Phyllis works at the cannery most hours. Abernathy - I ain't seen him in a few days. His domicile is near the cannery.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: You'll find 'em in town. All except Ludwig, that is. He's over by the landing pad.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be back.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Company policy. If it was up to me, I'd put the whole town ten feet under, free of charge.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: All right. I'll collect your fees for you.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Quotas, mostly. Got a backlog of graves to fill. Bodies won't bury themselves, you know.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never mind that. Let me ask you something else.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Heard a lot of new workers say that. First time they set eyes on Edgewater, they'll say, "I can't work here. I don't belong here."

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, we do belong here. The Spacer's Choice family takes care of us from the cradle to the grave. Long as we provide our own cradles.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: There was something else I wanted to ask.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: I am employed by the Retirement Department of Spacer's Choice. That's fancy-talk for working in the cemetery.

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm being vigilant. Don't wanna get blindsided by some corpse-chewing marauder come stalking out the shadows.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're telling me there's cannibals out there?

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: Worse. *Unemployed* cannibals. You ever seen a marauder hold down a job?  Or put a stake into society?

dialog.speaker: Silas (Male)
dialog.utterance: You talk too pretty for a marauder. Most of 'em just grunt and yell.
